a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (23:24): I always like to leave a little buffer since i'm not the only one using the account
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (23:24): mom grabs the cell and talks to a friend for two hours...  :|
c72dbdf529e69c1ae3fed7f262edaa92 (23:27): oh yuo are on cell
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (23:30): nah I'm still at home, but I shouldnt' be
edd5cc28df2a1432c3bd47cbc6fd3403 (23:40): i have a computer that keeps going down, i suspect the power supply, is there any reasonable way to test power supplies, or should i just buy a new one?
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (23:49): variable_office: volt-ohm meter, check the 5, 12, 3.3 volt legs for correct voltage (around 10%)
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (23:50): you can get ATX pinouts everywhere
edd5cc28df2a1432c3bd47cbc6fd3403 (23:50): how much is a volt ohm meter going to run?

05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (23:50): personally, if it seems to be the PS and they're not using a quality (enermax, antec, some others) or kinda-quality (FSP) unit, I just change it. Many cheap PSes are crap
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (23:51): variable_office: 10-20$ for a cheapy VO meter that works fine. you *should* already have one
edd5cc28df2a1432c3bd47cbc6fd3403 (23:51): i think i put a good psu in here
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (23:52): I'd suspect motherboard or PSU capacitors these days if it's 2-3 years old; there's so many of those problems
edd5cc28df2a1432c3bd47cbc6fd3403 (23:53): ah
edd5cc28df2a1432c3bd47cbc6fd3403 (23:53): what brands do you consider quality?
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (23:59): PSU: Enermax is my fav.; antec is also good, I heard of a 1-2 others but they don't come to mind right now
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (23:59): frankly, weight is a pretty good measure of ATX PSU quality in my experience. if it's very lightweight, quite certainly it's crap

92c1f658b3d16f2039994a213258cfbf (00:03): question - running an 802.11b AP, is the max bandwidth the AP can send/recieve 11Mb? -or- do individual clients have the potential to send/receive 11Mb seperately from the same AP?
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (00:06): max total network b/w is "11mbit"; due to 802.11 efficiency it's actually about half of that
e1faa87199b1fa927b53c2359f5bdf25 (00:14): !seen matthewa
edd5cc28df2a1432c3bd47cbc6fd3403 (00:29): DrDT i am getting an antec 550 now
5e592af3b714d39de3993c8616d0f28e (00:33): is there a comandline version of airsnort?
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (00:39): variable_office: nice, but maybe oversized. you'll need insane h/w to use 550 watts
edd5cc28df2a1432c3bd47cbc6fd3403 (00:42): well i am running dual procs in it
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (00:52): I have dual procs, and 9 HDs. my use is ~360W
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (00:53): although thsoe procs are athlon 1.8s so they take less wattage than the new ones
edd5cc28df2a1432c3bd47cbc6fd3403 (00:53): aye
edd5cc28df2a1432c3bd47cbc6fd3403 (00:54): if it turns out to be the mobo as it still crashes after the new psu, the psu cant be damaged by the unstable mobo can it?
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (01:03): good PSUs should be able to shut down for any wierd voltage condition, incl. a short from the mobo
edd5cc28df2a1432c3bd47cbc6fd3403 (01:03): ok cool
edd5cc28df2a1432c3bd47cbc6fd3403 (01:03): well i hope it is the psu, because dual proc mobos arent cheap
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (01:03): crappier ones may bnot have such protection and may be damaged
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (01:04): variable_office: how old is it?
edd5cc28df2a1432c3bd47cbc6fd3403 (01:06): the psu i only like 1.5 years
edd5cc28df2a1432c3bd47cbc6fd3403 (01:07): the computer is like 3 or 4, its a 2x2200mp system
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (01:17): I'd say suspect the capacitors on your mobo. what kind of mobo is it?
edd5cc28df2a1432c3bd47cbc6fd3403 (01:18): gigabyte
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (01:20): yeah, I think they were hit by the bad caps thing. you may need to replace your caps.
edd5cc28df2a1432c3bd47cbc6fd3403 (01:20): oooohhhh, so the motherboard may be bad?  the problem with the computer is just that it will randomly reboot, usually when i open an app
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (01:23): variable_office: try a replacement PS, try running memtest86, but randomly rebooting may mean bad caps.
edd5cc28df2a1432c3bd47cbc6fd3403 (01:24): ya, i didnt think about memtest
edd5cc28df2a1432c3bd47cbc6fd3403 (01:24): ill have to do that, i think i lost my old disk, guess ill have to make a new one
edd5cc28df2a1432c3bd47cbc6fd3403 (01:26): damn, well if the mobo is bad, i will just scrap the dual 2200s, put those in 2 seperate servers, and get myself a dual 940 board
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (01:29): don't scrap the 2 2200MPs, I'll take them off your hands
edd5cc28df2a1432c3bd47cbc6fd3403 (01:30): no, im not scraping them, they will go in servers
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (01:30): oh, you meant "seperate". OK.
edd5cc28df2a1432c3bd47cbc6fd3403 (01:30): yep
edd5cc28df2a1432c3bd47cbc6fd3403 (01:30): the upcoming voip server will enjoy having one of those
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (01:32): variable_office: check ebay
edd5cc28df2a1432c3bd47cbc6fd3403 (01:32): for what?
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (01:32): a couple 2200+'s and a working dual Socket A board gets enough dough to buy a real machine
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (01:32): "real" being something thats actually fast (those old dual athlons only share one badly-handled PC2100 bus)
edd5cc28df2a1432c3bd47cbc6fd3403 (01:33): but if my socket a board is dead it doesnt really help?
5970bd1634756232824f68fe3b6bb725 (01:33): DrDT: what is "bad caps"
edd5cc28df2a1432c3bd47cbc6fd3403 (01:33): capaciters
5970bd1634756232824f68fe3b6bb725 (01:33): mine randomly freezes, and yet it passes memtest86 and cerberus (intensive systemwide burnin) for 24 hours at a time.
5970bd1634756232824f68fe3b6bb725 (01:33): it doesn't reboot or whatever
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (01:34): variable_office: this is true

05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (01:34): there was a huge rash of bad caps 2-4 years ago due to taiwanese companies badly pirating a japanese formula. results: caps burst, hw freezes or crashes or doesn't boot.
edd5cc28df2a1432c3bd47cbc6fd3403 (01:34): J4k3 maybe ill get lucky and the board isnt dead
edd5cc28df2a1432c3bd47cbc6fd3403 (01:34): damn imperial chinese1
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (01:34): DrDT: or stuff keeps running hotter and hotter until they fail
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (01:34): (voltage spikes)
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (01:35): J4k3: I find my dual 1800MP machine runs very fast, even at PC2100 ram
edd5cc28df2a1432c3bd47cbc6fd3403 (01:35): DrDT i feel ya, i love this machine, its soo responsive and quick
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (01:36): dtm: ooh, that's a pickle. I'd suspect wierd sw/driver issue if it freezes but passes those tests fine

edd5cc28df2a1432c3bd47cbc6fd3403 (01:37): on another note, the HD in one of my servers was clicking, i rebooted and it failed to boot to it, i then let it sit a few minutes and now it boots fine.  do i replace the HD?
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (01:37): variable_office: yes, any clicking=dying
05346ab3db400d0ed757154ddb3f0800 (01:37): some do it fast, some (liek yours) do it slow.
edd5cc28df2a1432c3bd47cbc6fd3403 (01:38): ya, i guess i will just replace it.
edd5cc28df2a1432c3bd47cbc6fd3403 (01:38): lucky for me i am finally pulling in enough to keep some spares around
